docs.lead_paragraph: The Treasury Department on Monday gave employers an extension of critical reporting requirements, as it seeks to manage some of the most complicated parts of the federal health care law.

docs.lead_paragraph: For Mohammed, the perils of staying in Damascus crystalized when a sniper's bullet whizzed past his head while he and his cousins were on his rooftop, watching the Syrian air force bomb rebel forces.

docs.lead_paragraph: How domestic workers in Colombia achieved success in demanding better wages and treatment.

headline.main: A Maid’s Peaceful Rebellion in Colombia
headline.print_headline: A Maid’s Peaceful Rebellion in Colombia

docs.abstract: Ernesto Londono Editorial Observer applauds efforts of former maid Maria Roa on behalf of domestic workers in Colombia; notes Roa's success in organizing workers and winning protections for them; hails influence Roa's actions have had in other countries and on political and social movements within Colombia.
docs.snippet: How domestic workers in Colombia achieved success in demanding better wages and treatment.

docs.lead_paragraph: Many Republican governors support expanding coverage through the Affordable Care Act, a law that members of Congress from their party want to see fail.

headline.main: State-Level Brawls Over Medicaid Reflect Divide in G.O.P.
headline.print_headline: Medicaid Brawls in States Reflect Split in the G.O.P.

docs.abstract: Republican governors in number of states have announced intention to expand Medicaid coverage under Affordable Care Act, even as many Republican members of Congress are working to end or hobble law; situation has led to divide between governors and lawmakers that can no longer be ignored.
docs.snippet: Many Republican governors support expanding coverage through the Affordable Care Act, a law that members of Congress from their party want to see fail.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Jason Tsai is among the few in Taiwan with excellent English, but two years after graduating from university the highly sought language skill has failed to secure him a well-paying job.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Chris Christie has drawn accolades from supporters and detractors alike for his work addressing the opiate problem in New Jersey and elsewhere. But advocates and addicts say he is helping those already in trouble with the law and failing those who are looking to get clean before they slip up and find themselves in jail.

headline.main: Praise for Christie's Approach on Drugs Misplaced, Some Say
headline.print_headline: Praise for Christie's Approach on Drugs Misplaced, Some Say

docs.lead_paragraph: For six New Yorkers age 85 and older, whose lives were followed throughout the year, old age is a mixture of happiness and sadness, with less time wasted on anger and worry.
docs.abstract: New York City residents Jonas Mekas, Ruth Willig, Helen Moses, John Sorenson, Frederick Jones and Ping Wong, all over 85 years of age, have been visited by New York Times reporters throughout 2015 in effort to create a portrait of life for the elderly in New York; subjects turn the question back at their interviewers, asking them, following a year of investigation, if they now know better what they might want to do with themselves as they age (Series: 85 and Up).
docs.snippet: For six New Yorkers age 85 and older, whose lives were followed throughout the year, old age is a mixture of happiness and sadness, with less time wasted on anger and worry.

docs.lead_paragraph: Policies grow more costly the longer you wait to buy or if you are in poor health. Hybrid policies combine coverage with annuities and life insurance.
